intro: Hieracium florentinum, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium florentinum is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth and ability to spread rapidly.
